newsitem.title: GERMANY: Waigel says G7 cooperation on forex functioning.
newsitem.headline: Waigel says G7 cooperation on forex functioning.

text.p: German Finance Minister Theo Waigel said on Friday that cooperation among Group of Seven industrialised nations on foreign exchange rates was functioning.
Waigel also said the Bonn government expected 1997 German economic growth of about 2.4 percent and that "somewhat more" was possible.
Waigel declined to comment to journalists at an event on current foreign exchange rates, but said: "The G7 cooperation is functioning."
